results.title: The Web
results.creator_credit: Elisa Argenzio, Lucinda Clutterbuck, Sarah Watt, Fiona Eagger, ABC-TV (Australia), Australian Children's Television Foundation, Australian Film Commission, Eco Productions, Film Victoria and New South Wales Film and Television Office
results.brief_description: Narrated by Ruth Cracknell and superbly animated, thirteen short segments focus on the survival of endangered creatures in their fragile habitats. The emphasis is on highlighting the plight of the animals and to foster greater community respect. Preservation of wildlife and their habitats are crucial environmental issues, and this program of short films promotes this message simply and persuasively. The Panda, Wolf, Bandicoot, Cheetah, Shark, Rhinoceros, Falcon, Rattlesnake, Spider, Seal, Gorilla, Frog and Homo Sapiens are the animals featured. Suitable for Upper Primary students and for lovers of quality animation and wildlife.

results.title: The Weather map
results.creator_credit: Christopher Cordeaux, Malcolm Otton and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Explains how to interpret a weather map and how the Bureau produces it daily from the information collected by stations throughout Australia. Aimed at upper primary-, lower high school-aged students.

results.title: The Weakest link
results.creator_credit: Ronald Haines and British Foundation Pictures
results.brief_description: A very interesting film showing a community in England hand forging and forming of chain links. Both women and men working with primitive machines using methods that are timeless.

results.title: The Ways of water
results.brief_description: A study of water movement, currents, tides and waves and its application in irrigation and canal control. Filmed at the Hydraulic Research Station, Wallingford, England.

results.title: The Way...the eagle...(expletive deleted): an essay by Al Levin
results.brief_description: An irreverent satirical essay on U.S. economics. Shows how the ‘American Way’ depends on keeping the poor poor, both at home and abroad. Presented by journalist Al Levin.

results.title: The Way of the world
results.brief_description: Silent film exploring religious themes about a priest who ventures out into the streets amongst the workers to spread the word of god. Cast includes Henry B. Walthall, George Nichols, Florence Barker, Gertrude Claire.

results.title: The Way I see it
results.creator_credit: Jack Denove, Leon S. Gold and Roundtable Productions
results.brief_description: A case study which explores the effect of perceptual differences on supervisor-subordinate relations and on job performance. Looking critically and objectively at both sides the roots of the differences are seen as perceptual. The problem is not resolved.

results.title: The Waters of Coweeta
results.creator_credit: Dick Mosher and United States. Forest Service
results.brief_description: Shows the result of twenty years of research work at the hydrologic laboratory on the Coweeta Experimental Forest in the Natahala Mountains of North Carolina. Illustrates the experiments conducted to define more exactly the damage to water supplies and soil. This was done by creating the conditions of unplanned hillside farming, woodlands grazing, and indiscriminate logging.
